channel.title: IPBlocker V1.0 - The easiest IP Blocking software to use (FIXED)
channel.description:
[center]Okay well i'm finally finished this highly useful tool for you to manage blocked ips, new versions to come very soon, just download, extract and open up ipblocker.php. Read Below for more info. [br] [hr] Version 1.0: [b](fixed)[/b] [/center]
/* IPBlocker by tobias 25/6/2009 Description: Any page that includes this file will check through lines in a given file, there will be a bloced ip per line, and if the persons ip is found inside the file, they will be redirected to a given url and denied access to the page. Edit the settings below this comment. Instructions: 1. Add this line to the top of any pages to monitor: include("ipblocker.php"); 2. Edit the settings below 3. Add any additional blocked ips into the file inside $blocked_ips variable */
[center] [url=http://uppit.com/v/EN7FHYTF][IMG]http://i27.tinypic.com/2exqah0.gif[/img]Download .zip[/url] [IMG]http://i27.tinypic.com/2exqah0.gif[/img]Download .rar[br] Credits: 85% Tobias222, 10% Moparisthebest Forums, 5% php.net [hr] [/center]

item.source: IPBlocker V1.0 - The easiest IP Blocking software to use (FIXED)

item.title: IPBlocker V1.0 - The easiest IP Blocking software to use (FIXED)
item.dc:creator: @Zack77 Zack77
item.description:
@Zack77 wrote:

[quote=“tobias222, post:10, topic:290848”][quote author=sppt link=topic=384517.msg2885307#msg2885307 date=1248564587]
What do you want us to critcize? everything that is to be said has been said.
[/quote]

I meant if theres nothing for you guys to criticize, there is nothing for you to say meaning you guys are hardly ever positive.

[php]
$banned_ip = array();
$banned_ip[] = ‘IP’; //Example

foreach($banned_ip as $banned){
$ip = $_SERVER[‘REMOTE_ADDR’];
if($ip == $banned){
header(“Location: http://google.com”);
}
}
[/php]

[php]

<?php $bannedIp = array("127.0.0.1"); if(in_array($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'], $bannedIp)) { exit("You're currently ip banned from this site, please contact an administrator for assistance!"); } echo("Welcome back!, you're not ip banned, cool k"); ?>

[/php]
Would be a better way of doing it…but best of all, why don’t you guys just use .htaccess?

I know this would be more resource efficient and take less time but people want to update their banned ips automatically, and you cant really write to a php file in php just to change the arrays.[/quote]
Yes, but I was actually just trying to point out the one efficiency problem with your script, you’re using a foreach loop, when you should just use in_array function to check it.

Read full topic
item.source: IPBlocker V1.0 - The easiest IP Blocking software to use (FIXED)

@tobias222 wrote:

sppt:

What do you want us to critcize? everything that is to be said has been said.

I meant if theres nothing for you guys to criticize, there is nothing for you to say meaning you guys are hardly ever positive.

[quote=“Zack77, post:9, topic:290848”][quote author=cumescape link=topic=384517.msg2884480#msg2884480 date=1248521231]
[php]
$banned_ip = array();
$banned_ip[] = ‘IP’; //Example

foreach($banned_ip as $banned){
$ip = $_SERVER[‘REMOTE_ADDR’];
if($ip == $banned){
header(“Location: http://google.com”);
}
}
[/php]
[/quote]
[php]

<?php $bannedIp = array("127.0.0.1"); if(in_array($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'], $bannedIp)) { exit("You're currently ip banned from this site, please contact an administrator for assistance!"); } echo("Welcome back!, you're not ip banned, cool k"); ?>

[/php]
Would be a better way of doing it…but best of all, why don’t you guys just use .htaccess?[/quote]

I know this would be more resource efficient and take less time but people want to update their banned ips automatically, and you cant really write to a php file in php just to change the arrays.

item.title: IPBlocker V1.0 - The easiest IP Blocking software to use (FIXED)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:5, topic:290848”]That’s not a good way of really “blocking” users; it just prevents them from viewing your site content.

[php]if($_SERVER[‘remote_addr’] = $line) {
header(“Location: $blocked_redirect”);
}
[/php]
will not work correctly.[/quote]

Sorry, re-done it a little and uploaded, also removed ‘localhost’ from the banned ips list. should work a little better now.
I’m thinking of making an array in the php file with blocked ips, but it means the blocked ip list cannot be updated automatically by filtering software, might make a lite version with arrays.

Typical MITB … Nothing to criticize, nothing to say

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

That’s not a good way of really “blocking” users; it just prevents them from viewing your site content.

[php]if($_SERVER[‘remote_addr’] = $line) {
header(“Location: $blocked_redirect”);
}
[/php]
will not work correctly.

/* IPBlocker by tobias 25/6/2009

Description:
Any page that includes this file will check through lines in a given file,
